result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Joel Guichardo

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Letter of Support for Angel Guichardo

Branch 19 has accepted this case to resolve globally with pending case 20CF3911.
Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 19 Calendar. Defense request a plea and sentencing date.
Plea and Sentencing scheduled December 1, 2022 at 2:30pm.

Defendant Angel Joel Guichardo not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Franken for Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Final Pretrial this date.  Parties advise this matter may resolve with Defendant's other pending matters before Judge Ashley, Br. 19.  Court converts Jury Trial date to a Status date.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of rights and Addendum
Received and Filed. Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment
Received and Filed. STATES WITNESS LIST
Received and Filed. STATES MOTION IN LIMINE
Defense counsel requests to be heard on bail. Arguments heard by both parties as to bail. Court denied bail motion for todays purposes. Case adjourned to Br 16.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Angel J Guichardo not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. State advises that there may be a possible global resolution. Court sets Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial dates. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Angel J Guichardo not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials, but needs additional time to review with client. Court sets next court date for an additional Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Angel Joel Guichardo in court with Attorney Jason A Findling; both appear by video.  Defendant Angel Joel Guichardo in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 20JV627 & 20CF3911. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective D. Gaglione. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Angel Joel Guichardo in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Angel Joel Guichardo in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Angel Joel Guichardo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
